Title:
Two new endophytic Phyllosticta species from Southern
China
Abstract:
Phyllosticta is an important group of plant pathogenic
fungi distributed worldwide that cause serious diseases(Baayen et
al.Â 2002), In this paper, we introduce two new species of Phyllosticta,
from Illicium verum Hook. F and Dendrobium nobile Lindl. in Guangxi and
Jiangxi province of southern China, based on a polyphasic
characterization including host, morphology, and molecular phylogeny.
The phylogenetic analysis was conducted based on the ribosomal internal
transcribed spacer (ITS), large subunit 28S rRNA (LSU), actin (ACT),
partial translation elongation factor 1-alpha (TEF-1), and
glyceraldehydes 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GPDH) gene regions. Our study
confirms the phylogenetic distinctions of the two new species, as well
as their phenotypic differences with known species in the genus.
